column34: For 2003–2011: No rebalancing had been carried out on estimates from 2003 to 2011, and therefore the GDP series by industry structure for this period do not add up. For 2003–2020: There are changes in basic concepts in line with the changing of the base year to 2012 and a closer consistency with the System of National Accounts 2008. Improvements to methodologies, data sources, concepts, and revisions to benchmark estimates have been implemented. For 2021–2022: SINSO reflected revisions to 2020 and past years arising from methodological improvements and the population census to the current revised GDP estimates. Any methodological changes made for the current measures have been chained to 2020 levels to avoid distorting the growth rates.

column1: Agriculture, forestry, and fishing at current prices

column33: Samoa Bureau of Statistics (formerly Statistical Services Division)
column34: For 2007–2023: The overall system for estimating GDP at current and constant prices underwent methodological changes. These include: (i) update of base year for constant price estimates to 2013; (ii) incorporation of latest benchmarks; (iii) upgrade of the International Standard Industrial Classification (ISIC) classification from ISIC Revision 3.1 to ISIC Revision 4; (iv) increased reliance on summary data from the value-added goods and services tax system; and (v) incorporation of more detailed data on industry level. For a full explanation, see the national accounts report available on the Samoa Bureau of Statistics website at http://www.sbs.gov.ws. For 2009–2023: Refers to agriculture and fishing.

column1: Agriculture, forestry, and fishing at current prices
column29: The gross output of the agriculture sector, less the corresponding value of intermediate consumption. The industrial origin of value-added is determined by ISIC revision 4, where agriculture corresponds to ISIC Section A and includes agriculture, forestry, and fishing.
column34: For 2000–2023: Forms part of other goods industries comprising agriculture, fishing, and quarrying.

column34: For 2003–2011: No rebalancing had been carried out on estimates from 2003 to 2011, and therefore the GDP series by industry structure for this period do not add up. For 2003–2020: There are changes in basic concepts in line with the changing of the base year to 2012 and a closer consistency with the System of National Accounts 2008. Improvements to methodologies, data sources, concepts, and revisions to benchmark estimates have been implemented. For 2021–2022: SINSO reflected revisions to 2020 and past years arising from methodological improvements and the population census to the current revised GDP estimates. Any methodological changes made for the current measures have been chained to 2020 levels to avoid distorting the growth rates.

column33: Samoa Bureau of Statistics (formerly Statistical Services Division)
column34: For 2000–2006: Includes mining and quarrying, which are minimal. For 2007–2008: Includes mining and quarrying, which are minimal. For 2007–2023: The overall system for estimating GDP at current and constant prices underwent methodological changes. These include: (i) update of base year for constant price estimates to 2013; (ii) incorporation of latest benchmarks; (iii) upgrade of the International Standard Industrial Classification (ISIC) classification from ISIC Revision 3.1 to ISIC Revision 4; (iv) increased reliance on summary data from the value-added goods and services tax system; and (v) incorporation of more detailed data on industry level. For a full explanation, see the national accounts report available on the Samoa Bureau of Statistics website at http://www.sbs.gov.ws. For 2009–2023: Includes mining and quarrying, which are minimal. Refers to food and beverages manufacturing and other manufacturing.

column34: For 2003–2011: No rebalancing had been carried out on estimates from 2003 to 2011, and therefore the GDP series by industry structure for this period do not add up. For 2003–2020: There are changes in basic concepts in line with the changing of the base year to 2012 and a closer consistency with the System of National Accounts 2008. Improvements to methodologies, data sources, concepts, and revisions to benchmark estimates have been implemented. For 2021–2022: SINSO reflected revisions to 2020 and past years arising from methodological improvements and the population census to the current revised GDP estimates. Any methodological changes made for the current measures have been chained to 2020 levels to avoid distorting the growth rates.

column34: For 2003–2011: No rebalancing had been carried out on estimates from 2003 to 2011, and therefore the GDP series by industry structure for this period do not add up. For 2003–2020: There are changes in basic concepts in line with the changing of the base year to 2012 and a closer consistency with the System of National Accounts 2008. Improvements to methodologies, data sources, concepts, and revisions to benchmark estimates have been implemented. For 2021–2022: SINSO reflected revisions to 2020 and past years arising from methodological improvements and the population census to the current revised GDP estimates. Any methodological changes made for the current measures have been chained to 2020 levels to avoid distorting the growth rates.
